actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a reduction in the capital gain rates for all taxpayers and a partial dividend income exclusion for individuals, and for other purposes.
short_title: Capital Gains and Dividend Income Reform Act of 1998

summary.text: Capital Gains and Dividend Income Reform Act of 1998 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to revise rules concerning capital gain for taxpayers other than corporations to establish a new general rule which provides that if for any taxable year a taxpayer other than a corporation has a capital gain, 70 percent of such gain shall be a deduction from gross income. Reduces the alternative capital gain tax for corporations. Excludes from individual gross income 70 percent of dividends received from a domestic corporation.

titles.title: Capital Gains and Dividend Income Reform Act of 1998
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a reduction in the capital gain rates for all taxpayers and a partial dividend income exclusion for individuals, and for other purposes.
